center.bold: Mary Murphy, Appellee, v. Charles L. Wilkins and Clarence Carmody,

court.center: Appellate Court of Illinois, Fourth District.

opinion.syllabus:
DAMAGES, § 387[fn*] — nonexcessiveness of award for broken jawbone. $27,500 was not excessive for injuries sustained by 18-year-old girl, who had incurred medical and hospital expenses exceeding $1,000, where injuries consisted of a broken jaw bone and resulted in permanent disfigurement of face and neck and required her to give up a course of study in a university.
[fn*] See Callaghan's Illinois Digest, same topic and sectionnumber.
opinion.posture:
Appeal from the Circuit Court of Peoria county; the Hon. JOHN T. CULBERTSON, JR., Judge, presiding.
Judgment affirmed. Heard in this court at the February term, 1949.
opinion.opinion_text: Not to be published in full. Opinion filed April 21, 1949; rehearing denied June 8, 1949; released for publication June 8, 1949.Page 647
